overview: Hanford Reach, one of the most important wildlife refuges in Washington state, is an inadvertent legacy of the United Statesâ€™ nuclear weapons program. Lands within the monument originally served as a buffer around the Hanford Nuclear Reservation.  This short one-shot film is part of a series called Interpretive Sites. Directed by Adam Sekuler and choreographed by Karn Junkinsmith, these works explore abandoned locations using dance as an interpretive tool to elicit a sites history.
title: Interpretive Site: Hanford Reach
